bioghist.p: Originally known as the Inter-Society Committee for 20th Century Decorative Arts and Design, Collab is a group of design professionals formed under the leadership of Calvin Hathaway in 1970. Its aim is to enrich the collection of 20th century decorative arts at the Philadelphia Museum of Art. Collab supports a wide range of educational programming at the Museum, including exhibitions, publications, lectures, symposia, and a citywide, college-level Student Design Competition, as well as a distinguished annual Design Excellence Award. Collab is made up of members representing the American Institute of Architects, the American Society of Interior Designers, the Interior Design Council of Philadelphia,the National Home Fashions League, the Industrial Design Society of America, the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and other organizations. In 1971 the Inter-Society Committee held its first fund raising event, called COLLAB. In 1976 the group changed its name officially to Collab 20th Century, Inc. Its headquarters are maintained in the Department of Decorative Arts after 1700, at the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

scopecontent.p: These are the minutes and correspondence of Collab, from its creation in 1970 to 1982. The minutes include lists of members of the Committee, agendas, treasurer's reports, lists of acquisitions and desiderata, event and fundraising planning, and lists of committee and subcommittee assignments. The collection also includes correspondence of Calvin Hathaway, 1970, related to the group's launch party; Hathaway's list of desiderata for the Museum collection; and photographs taken at Collab events, 1974 and 1975.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
